publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-ÖyRothkuppelraumduring T III MQR 32 (on the frame); T III MQ 69 (on the fragment)

language.ana: frg:ls-cetom-classical frg:ls-cetom-aberrant-archaic frg:ls-peyrot-A3 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-malzahn-A5 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-tamai-A2 frg:ls-C14

seg.seg: ... oder sie [scil. die Lüge] bew(ahrt ihn) vor großer Schwierigkeit oder sendet ihm in (schwieriger Lage) eine Krücke entgegen.
... or it [i.e. a lie] sa(ves him) from great trouble or, in (a difficult situation), sends a crutch towards him.
If by his effort it attains death, he is no longer a monk.
If you are asked whether you don't transgress, say [so].

p.note: In general, this manuscript is written in the standard script type, but it still shows an archaic-shaped 〈ṣa〉 (cf. 264).
postäñe rano keriyemane waiyke mā weṣṣälle: cf. a4.

list.item:
Alternative classifications:
Peyrotarchaic ~ classical
Malzahnarchaic ~ standard
TamaiI-2 (400-500)
Tamai-C14C14

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a4-5 If by his effort it attains death, he is no longer a monk. 334
a8 If you are asked whether you don't transgress, say [so]. 700

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1-2 ... oder sie [scil. die Lüge] bew(ahrt ihn) vor großer Schwierigkeit oder sendet ihm in (schwieriger Lage) eine Krücke entgegen. 512
T III MQR 32 (on the frame); T III MQ 69 (on the fragment)
In general, this manuscript is written in the standard script type, but it still shows an archaic-shaped 〈<u>ṣa</u>〉 (cf. [[Malzahn 2007a]]: 264).

a1 oroce – – [wa]t\ na_t_aṅkaṃn-ne oroce maswkameṃ wa_t\ na_t_a – – – – a2 ne wa_t\ ṣ[p]īt[ai] wr[a]ntsai lyeweta_r\r-ne pos_t_añe tuk _p_arweṣṣe mātri – – – a3 yaipormeṃ kka _k_alporme(ṃ) wi indriñcä kektseñaṣṣe indri śau_l_aṣe [i](nd)[ri] – a4 om no ce_u ka_l_alne ykuwe_ṣ\ kautsiśco speltke yama_ṣ_aṃ su no cwi speltke a5 sa srukalyñe yaṃnmaṃ su mā _ṣ_p_a ṣamāne _m_aske_t_a_r\ mā lalālu mā _ṣ_p_a a6 śaket_sä\ so_i lalaitau ṣamāñemeṃ maske_t_a_r\ [_t_a](n)e [_t_a](n)e eṣṅke śau_l_a a7 sa warñai mā ya_ṣ_alle _m_akte kca _t_ane te yaknesa ike – – – (mai)yya campa a8 lle stināstsi kwri mā katka_t\ peparku poñ\ : 3 snai k[e_ś\] – – sa ñaktai a9 kte pañakte waiyke welyñe naksate waiyke welyñemeṃ klautkalyñ[e] – – – – – a10 te palāte pos_t_añe rano keriyemane waiyke mā we«_ṣ_ṣ»_alle k_u(c)e (_ṣ_p_a) – – – – – b1 k_use no ṣamāne mā ce warñai kca klyomot_s\ wāki yainmu sakwä _t_a[_k]älyñ[e] – – – – b2 _t_a_r\ aiykema_r\ wa_t\ te maṃn_tä\ lkāske= wa_t\ te maṃn_tä\ arahaṃnte ñi(_ś\ nese_u) ara b3 haṃnteñe «perne»ś wa_t\ speltkessu anāgāme ñi_ś\ nese_u [a](nāgā_m_aṃ) [ñ](e) perneś wa_t\ b4 speltkessu sakṛtākāme ñi_ś\ nese_u sakṛtākā_m_aṃ[ñe] (perneś wa)_t(\) speltke b5 ssu srotāpaṃnne ñi_ś\ nese_u srotāpa_t_añe pe(r)ne[ś] wa_t\ [s]p[e]ltkessu b6 _k_alpowä niś\ nese_u _p_arweṣṣe dhyāno wace dhyāno trice dhyāno śtarce dhyāno b7 eru ñiś\ nese_u mait_r_a karuno modi_tä upe_k_ṣä akāśanaṃntyāyataṃn\ wijñā b8 nanaṃntyātaṃn\ ākiṃñcaṃṇyāyataṃn\ naiwasajñānāsaṃjñāyataṃn\ «aś[u]»(bh\) [ā](nā)[p]ā b9 nasmṛti ña[kt]i ñiś\ lkātsi _k_anmaskeṃ nāki yakṣi preti kumbhāṃṇḍi – – – – (–)
a10. postäñe rano keriyemane waiyke mā weṣṣälle: cf. [[THT 1103]] a4.
